Package actor

Class Player

java.lang.Object
actor.Actor
actor.Player
public class Player extends Actor
Represents a user-controlled actor known as the player. This class extends the base Actor class and includes additional functionality specific to the player, such as movement, item interaction, and checking game state conditions.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(int x, int y)
      Constructs a new Player with the specified initial position.
      Parameters:
      x - The initial x-coordinate.
      y - The initial y-coordinate.

    • Player

      public Player()
      Default constructor for the Player class. Initializes the player with a default key.

  • Method Details

    • getIsAlive

      public Boolean getIsAlive()
      Checks if the player is alive.
      Returns:
      The living state of the player.

    • setIsAlive

      public void setIsAlive(Boolean state)
      Changes the living state of the player.
      Parameters:
      state - The state to set the living state of the player.

    • getOnExit

      public Boolean getOnExit()
      Checks if the player is on an exit tile.
      Returns:
      True if the player is currently on an exit tile, false otherwise.

    • setOnExit

      public void setOnExit(Boolean state)
      Sets the player's state to indicate whether they are on an exit tile.
      Parameters:
      state - True if the player is on an exit tile, false otherwise.

    • moveDirection

      public void moveDirection(Actor.Direction direction, game.PlayerInventory inventory)
      Handles actions after the player moves in a specified direction. This includes checking for collisions with blocks or monsters, interactions with items, and determining if the player has reached an exit tile or encountered a trap.
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction in which to move the player.
      inventory - The inventory of the player, used for item interactions.

    • useItem

      public item.Item useItem(String key, game.PlayerInventory inventory)
      Finds and uses an item from the player's inventory, removing it from the inventory.
      Parameters:
      key - The key of the item to use.
      inventory - The player's inventory containing items.
      Returns:
      The item that was used, or null if the item with the specified key was not found.

    • onChipSocket

      public void onChipSocket(int chipCount)
      Handles interactions when the player walks on a chip socket tile. Checks if the player has enough chips to open the socket and, if so, opens it.
      Parameters:
      chipCount - The current number of chips the player has.

    • getAlive

      public Boolean getAlive()
      Checks if the player is alive.
      Returns:
      true if the player is alive, false otherwise.

    • setAlive

      public void setAlive(Boolean alive)
      Changes the living state of the player.
      Parameters:
      alive - The state to set the living state of the player. Use true to indicate the player is alive, and false to indicate otherwise.
